posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Hopefully this is just a quick one.

Appreciating that morningstars (like light flails) can't be used in the off hand when Dual-wielding, is it still possible to use one in the main hand? My intention is to use a hatchet in the off hand, so minimizing AB penalties (thus also covering all 3 damage types).

I'm noodling about with a Ranger/ Bard/ RDD (STR-based, but with appropriate DEX for maxing the benefits of light armour), and morningstar never seems to get the love it deserves, so I wondered...

Cheers

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content: For a strenght based ranger dual wielding in light armor, dex 14 may be a target if you can cap dex with items and spells. That gives you dex 26, just enough to get +8, the max dex bonus of padded armor with a total AC comparable to full plate. But it is risky to go there without uncanny dodge.

Personally, I really like that build. I'd go with Kukris for dual-slashing, and a Warhammer for when you need the extra AC boost.

I'd tweak it slightly to try to start with 14 INT, and then I'd drop Improved Critical on the Bludgeoning weapon, since the threat range on those is quite underwhelming, and get Expertise. That would add versatility to the build, at the cost of HP. When you need a higher AC, you can go Warhammer / shield and fight in Expertise. When you want to dish out damage, switch to Kukris and crit their behinds off.

Very good stuff!
